billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION

title: Denies violent felony offenders a license to possess a firearm
summary: Provides that a certificate of relief from disabilities shall not enable a violent felony offender to obtain a license to carry, possess, repair or dispose of a firearm.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2246

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the correction law, in relation to denying violent felony
offenders a license to possess a firearm

SUMMARY:

This bill amends section 701 of correction law so that a certificate
of relief from disabilities prohibits a person convicted of a violent
felony offense from obtaining a license to carry, possess, repair or
dispose of a firearm.

JUSTIFICATION:

In the past, a certificate of relief from disabilities enabled a
person who had been convicted of a violent felony offense to obtain a
firearm.
Unfortunately, this ignores the fact that many of our state's felony
offenders are repeat felony offenders. It is inconceivable to provide
a felony offender with the very weapon which may convict him/her of a
future felony.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:

To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect immediately.
